meanings.definition: The quality or state of being insignificant.
meanings.sent1: The insignificance of the pebble on the beach was clear.
meanings.sent2: She felt the weight of her insignificance in the vast universe.
meanings.sent3: The ant chuckled at the insignificance of the crumbs compared to the giant cookie.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of things, his actions held as much significance as a single raindrop in a storm of thousands.
meanings.sent5: The insignificance of the tiny seed became apparent as it was lost in the vast field.

meanings.sent1: The insignificance of his role in the play did not bother him.
meanings.sent2: The insignificance of her words was evident in the lack of response.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's attempt to meow loudly only highlighted its own insignificance in the room.
meanings.sent4: The insignificance of the small pebble in the pond was overshadowed by the ripples it created.
meanings.sent5: The insignificance of the old toy became apparent as it gathered dust on the shelf.
